0.text_: "Thus do I remain in The Cage."\n—The Black Sage's Soliloquy

1.text_: Well! Look who's finally up.
Oh dear. So you did lose your voice after all.
Don't worry. Mama's here to help.
This way.
You've lost more than just your voice.
But I'm sure you already know that, don't you?
You've lost so much. But the time has come to reclaim it.
Life will be much harder if you can't speak, after all.
Come now, up the stairs.
These stairs are the entrance to your prison—a place known as "The Cage."

0.text_: "Sometimes I felt like all they wanted\nto do was fight. It was...terrifying."\n—Fragment of an audio recording

1.text_: Goodness, look at these\nrivers of sand! I wonder how\nsuch a thing came to pass.
Make sure you don't get\nany grit in your eyes!
I wonder where all of\nthis sand is going.
Do you see those black birds?
Let's head for the shiny\nblack light up there.
These strange statues are scattered throughout The Cage.
I don't know who made them, but I call them Dark Scarecrows.
Anyway, this is the first one, so we'll start here.
Oh dear. Are you lost?
Don't be scared, child.\nMama's here.
Go on. Try touching that\nDark Scarecrow.
Did you see the flock of\nblack birds that possessed\nthe bounty hunter?
They're nasty sorts who\nlike to fly in and warp\nthe story.
Well, we are not going to\nlet that stand, are we?
Your role is to defeat them \nand put the story back the \nway it's supposed to be.
But I suppose you already\nknow that, don't you?
This weapon is a memory of the staff held by the boy from the wastelands.
Your task is to fix warped memories like this\nin order to restore complete stories.
But we also need to collect weapons like these.
Do you have a rough sense\nof what you're supposed\nto do now, child?
Wonderful! Then let's\nkeep this up!
Also, Mama's here to help, \nso don't worry too much\nabout it, all right?
Yes, I suppose it is a lot\nto wrap your mind around.
It'll make sense as we find\nmore stories. Don't be afraid to ask for help!
I wonder what's beyond \nthat light?
Careful now! Mama doesn't\nwant you to trip and hurt\nyourself.
My, what a beautiful place.
I can't fathom how anyone managed to construct something so large.
Well, here's the second one. Are you ready?
We collect stories in order\nto regain what you have\nlost...
But we also do it to make\nyour wish come true.
So let's keep it up.\nSlow and steady wins\nthis race!
Hmm. I suppose I should \ntell you a little bit about\nThe Cage.
It's a truly massive structure.
Where you woke up, and this sandy area here, are just small parts of it.
To be honest, a great deal\nof The Cage is a mystery.
I'm not even certain who\ngave it that name.
There's a Dark Scarecrow.
To think that poor sick child had to travel the wastes in his condition!
Still, we've restored the third memory now.
If we can collect the next one, it will mark the end of the staff's tale.
Goodness, this place is\nnothing but stairs! I hope\nyour little legs are okay.
Still, I suppose it does\nallow us to see some\nrather lovely views...
Be sure to rest whenever\nyou start to feel tired, child.
Someone once said resting\nis the shortcut to success,\nafter all.
It's so bright here...
Ah, there's the fourth one. \nWe should be able to enter\nthe final memory here.
People who arm themselves tend to find their way into a fight.
I fear you will have to face a good deal of death from now on.
Are you ready?
He was a prince who was driven away from his own country.
And before breaking down, the machine tried so hard\nto guard his master's body.
This memory marks the end of the story they left behind inside this staff.
Well done, child. Do you see how the proper story\nis now stored inside the staff?
You should take it.
That is Will, one of the lost fragments that you should be collecting.
We should search out the next scarecrow to find a new story.
Up the stairs, now! We still\nhave a long way to go.

0.text_: "If only I'd had the strength... Whenever I look back, the pain of\nwhat I lost runs through me." —A Woman Imprisoned by the Past

1.text_: The road splits here. Mama thinks we should go right because it's the RIGHT way!
Hmm... But left also might be the right way.
If it wasn't clear by now,\nMama doesn't actually know.
That scarecrow has the next weapon.
Oh, this weapon is...
Anyway! Let's get started on its restoration, shall we?\nI wonder what kind of story we'll find this time.
Ah, yes. I see. The story of this weapon\nis all about that woman.
I feel like we've seen her somewhere before...
What could this black barrier be?
How can the enemy be acting outside of the scarecrows?
Well, let's just square them away as best we can as we go forward, okay?
What on earth could those dark creatures be after?
I'm sorry, child. There are just so many things that Mama doesn't know.
Look. Something's out there.
What could it be?
There are so many mysteries in The Cage, aren't there?
This second scarecrow will hold another part of the weapon's memory.
It won't open yet. Are the dark creatures causing this bit of trouble, too?
I see. This weapon speaks of war.
I suppose it's rare for the memories in these weapons to be peaceful ones.
That's a little sad.
This room is a bit strange, isn't it?
Can you see down there?
There are so many paths going every which way.\nIt's like a maze.
I wonder where the other paths lead.
Well then! Let's hop straight into restoring this, shall we?
The memories of the woman in this weapon...
She lost her arm and leg because of her dark past.
Wh-what!?
That was...
Looks like that monster ran off somewhere.
Anyway, the next memory we find will be the last for this part of The Cage.
We're almost there, child.\nJust keep going.
People need goals and hopes in order to live their lives.
Without them, we lose even our own meaning.
And for her, revenge was itself a form of hope.
Hope: The spirit of desire and the drive to move forward.
We have your second fragment back now. Let's keep it up!
There are still many things you need to reclaim.
Come now. The next fragment is waiting for you.

0.text_: "I was much too used to this feeling I had no name for."\n—Shattered Memory Data Fragment

1.text_: What are those things up ahead?
Oh my. Bird statues?
Oh! It broke!
I do hope no one saw that...
This building is so big...\nIt's just like a castle!
Let's fix the memory in the scarecrow and then invite ourselves in, shall we?
I didn't think it would open, honestly.
I know how you feel, but let's get the scarecrow squared away first, okay?
This gun...
Anyway, let's get started restoring this story, shall we?
This is the story of a gun-wielding mechanical soldier...
I suppose these are memories of when he first met the boy with the staff.
They were created and discarded entirely at the whim of another.
Well then, let's head over to the castle.
This isn't a terribly welcoming atmosphere.
Goodness, there certainly are a lot of them now!
It's the privilege of youth to move forward by breaking everything in your path.
...Don't you think it's about time we get a move on?
It would be much easier if we could just crash through those awful black barriers.
Now this is an odd room.
Well, let's keep going.
It's a waterfall of sand...
Looks like the path goes through it. Maybe there's a way to stop the flow.
Is that a switch?
The sand stopped! Oh, how lovely. Now we can move past it!
There's a switch here, too.\nGive it a push.
Ah, this one opens up the first path. How clever!
It's almost like it's meant to waste an intruder's time.
The path is open now.
This is not the time to be turning back.
We might be missing something here.
There must be other paths besides the one blocked by sand...
Found you, Mr. Scarecrow.
Let's get to restoring this memory.
I imagine you're getting used to this by now.
Wonderful! Let's keep it up.
These stairs look terribly unsafe.
It does seem like an effective way to keep intruders out, though...
The Cage is just filled with mysteries, isn't it?
Oh, that's...
It's the monster that attacked us earlier!
Are you going to chase it?
It's almost like it's calling to us...
Hmm. It's not here.
Well, let's take care of the scarecrow for now.
I understand wanting to rush ahead,\nbut let's sort out things here first, okay?
A memory of war...
So that's why that poor child was driven from his country.
The king wished for control, while the prince prayed for peace and happiness.
They were both thinking of their country, so why did it have to end up so?
Why is there a person in a place like this?
''Scuse me! Miss!?
I've been waiting here for a really long time,\nbut my mommy still hasn't come!
I miss my mommy so much, and I was hoping you could \nput me in that scarecrow like you did with Mr. Monster!
...I'm sorry. Mama can't help you.
Let's be off.
Mommy...
Leave him be.
I wonder who put these here?
They're just a terrible nuisance.
That old man has been expelled from the story.
I feel terrible, but there's nothing we can do for him.
We must be careful not to end up lost like him.
...It seemed like that old man knew about you and the monster.
And he spoke like a child...
I wonder what happened to him?
This is the last part of the mechanical soldier's story.
Let's see how the memory ends, shall we?
After learning to have his own will,\nthe machine soldier swore to protect the boy.
They both fought—the boy for peace, and the machine for him.
That must be how their memories were intertwined.
This is the third fragment.
Prayer... Of all emotions, I believe this one might be especially human. \nIt is a heart that fills in the blanks of a vague future.
Well? Do you feel anything different?
My, that's wonderful! Let's keep this up and get those fragments back.
Then your wish can come true, too.
Oh. Well, there is still so much you lack.
We'll take baby steps to get it all back. One at a time, now!

0.text_: "Kill more swiftly than death—before the final breath can be drawn."\n—From a Fragment of a Bloody Diary

1.text_: The Cage feels quite different here. How lovely!
It's been awful and dusty for the most part, but the air here is nice and clear.
You know, we found sand in a part of The Cage that had memories of a wasteland.
Perhaps the local scenery is influenced by the weapons' memories.
Do you see that? The air is so clear here, fish even swim in it!
Hmm... That's actually quite odd now that I think about it.
Looks like we've found our first memory in this area.
Oh my. This looks like a katana.
Maybe we'll hear a story about a samurai.\nLet's have a look, shall we?
This story feels quite different from the others we've seen.\nI'm now convinced the scenery in The Cage is related somehow.
Well, it seems this tale involves a female assassin.
I wonder what the secret to her strength is.
Sometimes I wonder what those dark foes are trying to accomplish.
Do they just want to slow our progress, or is there some deeper goal?
My, that's a large gate.
We certainly won't be able to lift this on our own.
There must be a mechanism that operates it somewhere.
Let's search around a little more.
The mechanism for the gate must be around here somewhere.
When you can't find what you're looking for,  \nthe best thing is to search high and low.
What a good eye you have! Here, let Mama take care of that for you.
There now! That wasn't so hard.
A collapsed bridge?\nOh dear.
The scarecrow is so close! There must be a way to get past this.
Wait here, child. Mama will take a quick peek around.
Oh, but this is a bother.\nWho even lowered the water in the first place?
I do wish these levers weren't quite so heavy...
Right then! One down and three to go.
I think our mission is going quite well so far.
I just hope those two find happiness.
Wonderful! That did the trick!
Now we can cross to the other side.
That certainly did take a lot of time.
Well, let's get back on our feet and continue with the restoration, shall we?
Her whole life had been decided before she was even born.
How sad that has to be the reason for her strength.
It's rather a tragedy, don't you think?
I'm sure you must have a birthplace as well. A place you...
...No, don't mind me.\nI'm sorry.
Hmm...
Do you hear that?
*giggle*
That's...
It escaped again.
What's that sound?
Oh! The stairs make music when you step on them.
Do you think that monster was...playing the steps?
That's a rather cute thing to do, don't you think?
Well, I suppose it would be odd for a creature like that...
I wonder if the scarecrow has anything to do with the musical stairs?
The next memory should be the last one in this area.
I wonder what the monster wants. And those other dark foes, for that matter.
I think the last scarecrow in this area is inside this building.
I wonder what the woman in the tale will do?
Oh my! Again? What terrible timing these things have.
Let's hurry on. The last scarecrow should be close.
We'll need to open this gate first.
There's likely a lever nearby just like last time.
Mama will open this straightaway.
There! Can you get through now?
This next memory should restore the weapon.
The scarecrow is right there. Brave faces, now!
All right, let's begin the restoration.
It's time to secure the fourth fragment.
Perhaps freedom in the truest meaning of the word \nnever existed to begin with.
We are bound by heavy chains, which closes many doors.\nAnd one often lacks the will to choose from the remaining options.
Anger... This is the fourth fragment that you've lost.
What is your anger meant for?
Is it for a person? The world? Your fate?
Or perhaps...yourself?
The time when you will also have to choose draws nearer.

0.text_: "I was born at the foot and raised at the peak, and when I descend,\nI'm just a silly old fool." —A mountain people's saying

1.text_: Brrr! It's so cold all of a sudden.
Is this...snow that's falling?
Even The Cage has varying weather, it seems.
Falling snow... Glimmering icicles... Why, even that fabric is frozen over!
I never thought I'd get to see such a beautiful sight.\nMama is truly touched!
The fifth weapon should be here.
As well as the fifth fragment.
Now, let's head for the Dark Scarecrow.
Is that...a spear?
I wonder what kind of memory would cause a snowy Cage?\nWe should start restoring it right away.
So this memory is from an adventurer.\nHe certainly looked strong, don't you think?
I've never climbed a mountain before. Er, not that I could,\nseeing as my legs don't touch the ground...
We'll be fixing memories inside a spear this time.
I wonder if those dark foes feel the cold at all.
Are YOU cold, child? Why, you don't even have mittens!
Well then, come here and let Mama warm you up!
...All right, then. Mama will be quiet.
Are you SURE you aren't cold?
...All right, then. Mama will be quiet.
*gasp*
Oh, I can't! I know I promised to be quiet, but I just can't!
Make sure not to slip on the snow now!
This is turning into a proper blizzard. We should hurry.
...I wonder if it's trying to tell us something.
My, but that was close! Be sure to take it slowly and watch your step, okay?
I see another scarecrow.
That's the third one.\nLet's get this done.
He left his pregnant wife to climb a mountain? What an awful man!
This fabric has frozen, turning it into a bridge...
Be careful not to slip!
I hear it's best to stay calm and take small steps.
Also, lean forward and firmly plant your foot when—
Are you listening to me?
The blizzard has calmed somewhat, hasn't it?
Once we restore the next memory, we can leave this snowy area.
It's pretty, but it makes it hard to see or keep your balance.
And it's so COLD! Brrrrr...
No matter how lovely it is,\nI wouldn't want to be out\nhere for too long.
Oh dear. It's a ramp.\nWill we be all right?
Eeeeeeek!
Ha ha! Oh goodness, my poor bum is frozen!
Still, that was great fun. Perhaps we'll come back here sometime.
Let us enter the spear's final memory.
I wonder if the adventurer manages to get home safely.
His family was an illusion...
No matter how strong we are, we cannot live alone.
That man's story was so terribly sad.
It seems grief waits for everyone at some point in our lives.\nYet there are times we have no choice but to keep moving forward.
That's why you've come all this way, isn't it?
Let's go. We have a final fragment to reclaim.

0.text_: "To return it to where it is supposed to be—to how it is meant to be..."\n—The Dark Fool's lament

1.text_: This is the final stop on your journey.
The time has come to restore the final memory.
We will regain all that you have lost...
So that we might fulfill your wish.
Your memories are engraved in this scarecrow.
Let us begin.
I know it's painful, but let's keep going.
These memories are deeply entangled with you; restoring them will not be easy.
Do you know what that monster is?
It is a creature who steals and eats human dreams for want of their form.
But perhaps you know more about that than I do.
Come, then. Let us search for the next scarecrow and memory.
Do you remember how to use this terminal?
You came through here with her once, didn't you?
This is the second memory. Are you ready?
Are you all right?\nCan you walk?
Like I said before, the more we restore, the deeper your pain will grow.
The dark foes' attacks grow ever more vehement.
...The path has been cut off.
Though even if the path was there, there is no going back.
When we finish restoring all of these memories, I will ask you one more time.
So prepare yourself for that moment, all right?
Can you still walk?
...All right.
Regardless of what you choose, the next memory will be the last.
...Let's get a move on.
Restoring the tale of what you have done is penance for your sins.
But soon that, too, will come to an end.
Will you realize your wish? Or...
This is the last—truly and well the last memory.
The moment you complete this restoration,\nyou will regain all you have lost.
And there, you will find your sins waiting.
Four months earlier...
...I will eat your nightmares.
To be continued...
Hey, Carrier.
Yes, my good sir! How may I help?
Where are we going today?
Please proceed down this path, Master Levania.
You... You're a monster!
Such cheek! I will have you know that Master Levania\ndescended upon this world from a—
Oh... I'm having another scary dream! *sob*
How delightful!
Oh! It's almost morning!
My name's Fio, by the way.
See you tomorrow, Mr. Monster.
How fortuitous to have found someone\nfreely willing to provide their dreams!
Indeed.
I think things will be quite busy from here on out. Oh my, yes...
Ah, so you'll be devouring this girl's dreams, yes?
And then you'll become human!
That was how I met the girl in white.:<TAP>
\n\nThere was no way for me to know if this was simply a coincidence or a planned inevitability—not that I was interested.:<PAGE>
\nI search for human dreams, eat them, and become human myself.:<TAP>
\nThat instinct is all that drives me.:<TAP>
\n\nThe girl cried about how she had nightmares every night, and said she wanted me to eat her dreams.:<PAGE>
\nI had only one thought back then::<TAP>
\n\n"Excellent. I will make good use of her.":<PAGE>

0.text_: "Whether my reason for living be tragedy; \nwhether my reason for fighting be despair..."

1.text_: I believe it is now night in that world.
The slumbering young miss will soon arrive.
Right then. Here we go!
Welcome to The Cage, young miss! It is the world connected to your dreams.
This place is called...The Cage?
Indeed it is.
Wooow... Oh, Mr. Monster! You're back.
You're gonna eat my dreams like you promised, right?
...Hmph.
Now then, if you would both please proceed forward.
I shall explain all you need to know as we make our way.
Soonest begun, soonest done, eh? Ha ha! Let us be off!
To think we would so quickly find a client whose interests match our own.
A fine outcome for all concerned, says I!
This is way nicer than the\nplace where I was locked up.
Ah, yes. An elevator.\nWe truly do have all the\nmodern amenities here!
You talk too much.
What's that?
A Dark Scarecrow—though I\nam uncertain who first gave\nthem that moniker.
So this scarecrow is my scary dream?
Er, not exactly—although they are similar in a number of respects.
Take care of my dreams, Mr. Monster!
I will—but only because I want to.
In order to eat the girl's dreams, we must first restore these memories—\nwhich happen to be her dreams' original forms.
Anytime we find one of these Dark Scarecrows,\nwe should proceed with its restoration posthaste!
What was my dream about?
I fear it was a horrid tale\nof flower monsters that\nkill people.
Fret not! When you wake, you will remember nothing of these terrible visions.
Goodness, what is this?
The dark foes have\nencroached on The Cage!
We cannot permit them to\naffect the dreams, so let\nus square them away.
My dreams are always\nso scary.
I don't know the people\nin them, but they all\nget hurt or die.
Mmm, yes. You appear to\nbe a human particularly\nsuited for this world.
Perhaps these memories from across space and time play out as dreams to you.
I didn't understand most\nof that, but, um... Okay.
Have a nice time, Mr. Monster!
It appears the memories saved in these scarecrows\nare from a world whose people do not know freedom.
How terribly suffocating.
A world without freedom?
So the world has a collar\nlike I do?
Well, it does not actually\nhave a collar...
If I may ask, young miss,\nwhy DO you wear that collar?
I wear a collar 'cause\nthe law says I have to.
...Yes, well, I suppose you\nhave your reasons.
Let us continue downward on this magnificent elevator!
What a convenient world we\nlive in, wouldn't you say?
I wish I could have happy dreams.
Maybe one about cute clothes or pretty jewelry?
Or a cake that never runs out! ...Or my mommy's stew.
Dream whatever dream you like, so long as I get to eat it.
Oh ho! A dead end! Hmmmmm, whatever shall we do?
Why are you so smug?
Ha ha! It was actually a\nwarp point! Clever, no?
Whoa! That was crazy!
Ah, look! Scarecrow number\nthree at last!
Well done! Though I do\nwonder what happened to\nthose prisoners...
Did someone get hurt again?
Don't trouble yourself too\nmuch about it, young miss.
Our memory restoration is\nproceeding rather smoothly,\ndon't you think?
I'm tired. This place is far too big.
I must say, I've never met a human who saw weapon memories as dreams.
So I'm weird?
Of course not! You are a\nmost valuable samp— Er,\nclient! Yes, that's it.
The next restoration will \nbe tonight's last, so let \nus pick up the pace!
Kay.
What does eating dreams feel like, Mr. Monster?
Are they yummy?
I'm sorry if they're not.
Taste is meaningless.
Oh ho, we are in the home stretch now. Let's go!
Good luck, Mr. Monster!
To think he lost not only his child, but his wife as well...
Such sadness could scarce be described with words.
At any rate, this concludes tonight's memory restoration.
And now, the moment you've been waiting for: dream time!
Eat the nightmares before our young miss here wakes up.
You will need to consume many more dreams \nif you wish to become human, you know.
Oh, my. It's almost time for our young miss here to wake up.
I had lots of fun today. See you tomorrow, Mr. Monster!
Let us be on our way as well.
...This is a dead end.
Is it now? Look over there,\nif you would be so kind.
After you!
Let us proceed to the young miss's dreams of tomorrow!
Oh, but this IS exciting!

0.text_: The Second Night: Piles of Leaves
I will embrace you. Tightly—so tightly. To prove all of this is real.

1.text_: And... Ah, yes. There we are.
Hello, Mr. Monster.
I didn't have ANY\ndreams last night!
Such is the power of a\ndream eater. He dined\nquite well, oh yes!
I'm excited for today, too!
Hmph.
Carrier.
Yes? What might you need?
Do you come here a lot?
Indeed—one might even\ncall it my workplace!
I have guided many customers like yourself, all of whom have their own goals.
Not to boast, but I received the performance MVP award for this past year!
It was a yes or no question.
Such a harsh response!
Now then, let us get to restoring tonight's memories.
If that's what it'll take to become human, fine.
I hope the dream isn't scary.
The path I was shown descended endlessly.:<TAP>
\n\nHuman stories are filled with obsession, jealousy, hatred, grudges, and hypocrisy.:<TAP>
\nHowever commonplace and boring an observation it may be, humans can seemingly only find themselves in interactions with others.:<PAGE>
And those were also the girl's nightmares.:<TAP>
\n\nShe showed restlessness, sympathy, dread, and grief at every twist and turn...:<TAP>
\nAnd I saw her as an innocent little creature.:<TAP>
\n\nA creature the exact opposite of myself.:<TAP>
\nI felt not so much disgust, but fear.:<PAGE>
Fear that I had somehow taken an interest in this pure girl.:<PAGE>
Welcome back! Did you have fun?
It seems to be a continuation of yesterday's dream.
The one about the man who lost his family?
The very same—although happily, it seems the wife had survived.
Oh, but I have a good feeling about how this one will end!
Yay!
Say, Mr. Monster? Do you have any siblings?
Siblings?
I do not know—or care.
I'm an only child, and I'd do ANYTHING to have a brother or sister!
So, um...do you have a favorite food?
Whatever I can eat.
No.
My mommy makes yummy stew.
Do YOU like stew?
I don't know what that is.
So, um, I wanted to talk more yesterday, but I was kinda nervous.
But that makes sense, right? I mean, I'm in this weird world and stuff, sooo...
I understand nothing you humans go on about. Keep quiet.
Awww...
Look, Mr. Monster! Look, Carrie! It's the next scarecrow!
Ca...rrie?
At least I'm not the only one with an insipid nickname.
Good luck, Mr. Monster!
It seems this story will not\nend happily after all...
Oh...
So what's YOUR favorite\nfood, Carrie?
I love nothing more than a heaping plate of dried and salted fish eggs!
Blech!
It may be something of an acquired taste. Perhaps you need to be older to enjoy it.
Have you had salty fish\neggs, Mr. Monster?
No.
Hee hee! That means\nyou're a kid, too!
Human clones. Oh dear.
What's a "clone"?
It might be a touch difficult for you to understand, young miss.
What's that huge...thing?
Is that a...moose?
That is a cursed god; it being in this part of The Cage brings wickedness!
Goodness! Is this your summoning power!?
Good luck! I shall stand aside and cheer you on from a safe distance!
Don't get hurt, Mr. Monster!
You have defeated a cursed god! I am nothing less than impressed.
You're so cool, Mr. Monster!
Divinity means nothing to me, after all.
I suppose something called a "god" wouldn't be easy to defeat.
Well, we shan't be cursed by a spirit we let lie, I suppose.
What's a curse?
We don't have time to deal with gods right now.
Indeed, we cannot lose sight of our original goal!
I have heard that some even\npray to those cursed gods. \nHow terribly dreadful!
Is it a bad moose?
Oh yes. It has a grisly\nface, and likes to appear\nright in front of you!
And that's...bad?
Color me impressed that you did not flinch in the face of the cursed god.
Were YOU scared, Carrie?
I, ah, er... Yes.
That will be tonight's final Dark Scarecrow!
Death borne from love for her partner...
There is a very fine line between joy and misery.
I don't understand either of those emotions.
In any case, it is now the moment you have been waiting for: dream time!
It seems it is almost morning in the other world.
Thank you. And, um... I wish we could have adventured more together.
We shall meet again once night falls. Come now.
Let us be off, shall we?
You've grown used to gathering dreams, haven't you?\nWell, let's keep up the pace!

0.text_: "Revenge is all I have. Without that, it's just...fear."\n—Musings of a lonely boy

1.text_: And there we are!
Pardon me, you two, but I fear management has given me\nsomething of a sudden summoning.
Might it be all right if a substitute took care of you today?
Ah, speak of the dickens! Here comes the substitute now!
Nice to make your acquaintance.
Worry not; I shall be returned before you know it. Ta!
I'm your substitute carrier.
If you're a substitute,\nI'm gonna call you Tutie!
To get through here you gotta pull this lever.
I need to pull the lever?\nGot it. Thanks, Tutie!
Wooow! It's like there\nare waterfalls of sand!
Oh! I think I forgot about \nmy dream from last night!
You really are amazing, \nMr. Monster.
I am not eating your dreams \nfor you, you know.
This will be our first scarecrow of the day.
Yes, I am well aware.
Have fun! Byeee!
Was it another bad dream?
Whoa, these stairs make sounds!
Isn't this fun, Mr. Monster?
Not really.
Is this making you dizzy?
I am fine.
This is a tale of burning revenge.
What's "revenge"?
When someone harms you,\nyou repay them in kind.
That's bad!
The world would be terribly\nunfair otherwise, no?
My teacher said it's bad!
I wonder where Carrie went.
Who cares?
Eeep! That was scary!
The lever is stuck.
This is probably because of the dark foes. Take care of the scarecrow first.
Entering enemy territory alone is very reckless.
Why do you wanna be human, Mr. Monster?
It is an instinct among my kind.
Ohh... In-stink, huh?
When I grow up, I have an\nin-stink to be a ballerina!
I've wanted to be one ever\nsince I read a picturebook \nabout ballerinas.
Do you think I can be one?
I'm certain I have no idea.
This will be today's last scarecrow.
Good luck!
It...was a sad story, wasn't it?
I wish you'd tell me more about the dreams...
It is time for tonight's dreaming.
I have returned! Terribly sorry to have caused you so much trouble.
It's always such a shock to be called in on short notice like that.\nI do wish they would find a different way...
Well then, I'm off.
Let's play again sometime, Tutie!
Okay.
I wish I could stay here forever.
I doubt that is possible, milady.
You are not part of this world, you see.
See you tomorrow night.
Now then... There we go!
I'll be right back, so just wait. Okay, Mr. Monster? You too, Carrie.
Oh, with bated breath...
Now, let us proceed forth.
Dear me, I've not been here long and I am already covered in sand. I could use a quick soak in the tub!

0.text_: The Fourth Night: Flickers of Light
"It's okay, you're not going to die. I mean, I'm still alive, right?"\n—Conversation within a platoon

1.text_: I've been waiting for you.
Hee hee! Thanks.
Now, let us proceed onward. Briskly now, friends! Briskly!
So it's nighttime here, too.
Yes, it does indeed seem\nthat way sometimes.
Oh no! They broke!
Are we gonna get in trouble?
Now let us begin with\nthis Dark Scarecrow.
My substitute said these are\nstories of war related to\nlast night's dreams.
Hmm. "Stories of war," huh?
I hope you can be human soon, Mr. Monster.
Judging by your dreams, it\nseems all you humans do is\nworry and fret.
Do you even enjoy your lives?
Well, I sure do!
I play with my friends, eat snacks, read books...
I get to be with my\nmommy and daddy...
Mmm? What is it?
N-nothing...
Mommy... *sniff*
What is this child doing here?
Dear me, I have no idea.
What's wrong?
A buncha mean soldiers came to the village,\nso me and my Mommy were gonna 'scape...
But I got lost... *sniff*
Heavens, I believe this child was chased here from inside the scarecrow!
Can that even happen?
It appears so—though I imagine it to be a rather rare occurrence.
*sniff* I want my mommy... *sniff*
Can you go find his mommy in the scarecrow, Mr. Monster?
Pleeease?
You will be entering the Dark Scarecrows regardless, so I suppose\nit could not hurt to search for the missing mother as well.
I didn't think this could get any more annoying, yet here we are.
The girl always looked to be having fun as we traveled.:<TAP>
\nShe had been plagued by nightmares and spent untold nights in tears in her old life, but she looked downright cheerful in the world of The Cage.:<TAP>
\n\nEven though humans are at the whims of their emotions, it seems their souls shone brighter with each bout of emotional turmoil, and I could not understand why.:<TAP>
\nBut that was the first time that I knew I wanted to be human so I could see the world from the same perspective as her.:<PAGE>
Did you find the boy's mommy?
Hmmm...
Hey, why don't you come with us so we can look for your mommy together?
Kay, I'll go with you. Thanks!
Yay! He's coming with us, Mr. Monster! Isn't that great?
So the woman inside the\nscarecrow who died while\nsearching for her son...
That was the boy's\nmissing mother, yes?
If I may, why do you not\ntell him the truth?
My son...
Where is my son...?
An enemy from within the Dark Scarecrow!?
Oh no. Could she have been...?
That's... No! That wasn't my mommy!
Could you search the scarecrow again, Mr. Monster?
...Fine.
Did you find her, Mr. Monster?
No.
I'm gonna wait here for my mommy.
But it's not safe! What if those nasty dark things come back?
If I leave, my mommy won't be able to find me.
...Okay. I understand.
Thank you! Bye, Mr. Monster!
You were unable to tell him\nthe truth, it seems.
I've no interest in making a child cry.
I had no idea your emotions ran so deep!
Why, I'm shocked! Utterly gobsmacked, I say!
I'm gonna be a good boy and wait here till my mommy comes.
*huff* *huff*
Is something the matter?
N-no... Um, so, the next dream is the last one, right?
You appear tired. Is this because I am eating your dreams?
Don't be daft. The act of\nhaving dreams eaten has no\nphysical effect on a person.
I'm okay. Don't worry.
*huff* *huff*
This is tonight's final scarecrow!
One cannot help but wonder what will become of the boy and the captain...
My word, a happy ending! How terribly unusual.
It's good to see that the captain's wish to not let anyone die seems to have prevailed.
And now, for our favorite event: dream time!
I guess I go back now, right?
You're acting...strange.
I'm okay.
Um, see you...tomorrow...
And there we have it!
Hmm. I fear something in the other world may be causing her to weaken.
And what exactly would that "something" be?
No need to worry about that, mmm?
It's not as if it affects you.
Tomorrow, you shall feast on her dreams and take another step\nin your quest to become human!
Now let us proceed to the next part of The Cage. Quickly now!

0.text_: The Fifth Night: Mist on the Water
"They gave her a new name, perhaps because it was too painful\nto call her by the old one." -A researcher's diary

1.text_: And...here we go!
Are you well?
Yes, Mr. Monster. I'm sorry for worrying you.
Now let us make our pilgrimage to each Dark Scarecrow with gusto!
Ooo, pretty! There's\nwater everywhere.
Can we go play in it?
I fear we've no time to\nspare for splashing about,\nyoung miss.
You have eaten quite a lot \nof the young miss's dreams.
I believe the day you \nbecome human is nigh!
...Indeed.
Bye...
Ah, so this is the tale of a\ngirl created to be a weapon.
What the—!?
Good heavens! It ran off!
Explain this.
I, er, fear I have never seen a scarecrow take flight in such a fashion before.
It would seem they are\ncapable of moving.
Ugh. How annoying.
If it runs again,\nI will kill it.
I'm not even certain you CAN kill it. It's made of a very strange substance.
Oh, at last!
Stand back while I tear this blasted thing to ribbons.
Ah, interesting. So this girl—this living weapon—\ngoes about collecting memories, mmm?
*huff* *huff*
Shouldn't you rest or...something?
I'm okay...
Listen to me: If you die,\nI don't get to eat any\nmore of your dreams.
So stay alive until I'm done—then you can do as you like. Got it?
*huff* Got it!
Let's stop and rest here for a bit.
*huff* You mean it?
You wanted to play in the water, right? Well...knock yourself out.
Yaaay! Oh, thank you, Mr. Monster! Thank you!
Are you certain we have the time to dawdle like this?
She's feeling down. It concerns me.
You don't say...
Did you see that?
Hmmm?
Hey, Mr. Monster?
When you become human, will you still be my friend?
Right then, that's the end of playtime! Time to be moving on!
The path is flooded. I mean, I don't mind it, but...
It may be trying for the young miss here. Let us search for a way around.
Feeling better?
Yeah, lots!
Thanks again, Mr. Monster.
I see the next scarecrow!
Don't you go anywhere.
Okey doke!
I can't help but feel like something is amiss.
You must be close to consuming the required amount of dreams.
I doubt there's any problem \nhere. Carry on, my good man!
You're almost there,\nMr. Monster.
I'm gonna be really happy\nwhen your wish comes true.
You are happy when someone else's wish comes true?
Yeah, 'cause when YOU'RE\nhappy, I'M happy—and then\nwe're all happy together!
That's...what my teacher says, anyway.
That certainly was a tale of a very strange world.
Oh my, it's almost time.
Yeah, I have to go...
Perhaps you should not return to the other world.
Your behavior grows stranger each time you come here.
But...my mommy might be waiting for me...
We will soon reach the end of our journey.
The day your wish comes true is so close now!
You will sometimes encounter black birds in The Cage,\nand you should do what you can to shoo them all out.
If you do that, Mama will give you a nice surprise!
Oh, and the black birds aren't necessarily just hidden around\nDark Scarecrows, so keep an eye out for them.
Both story restoration and fragment collection are going well—\nand Mama has presents for good children like you who work hard!
So, tell me, which do you like more:\nstuffed animals or dolls?
...You think they're basically the same? They're totally different!\nLet's go with a stuffed animal, shall we?
Aren't stuffed animals just the cutest?
A doll it is, then.
But this gift is no simple toy—it's a reliable "companion"\nthat will fight alongside you in battle!
Companions come in five different affinities, but for now you can pick\nbetween fire and wind. Either one would be a big help.
Okay, here you go.
I think that's a great choice.
Make sure to equip it and you'll be able to meet it during battle!\nI'll show you how to make the magic happen.
How about the fire one?
Now let's keep going, shall we?
I have something special for you\nthat should serve as a nice change of pace.
Once you're all refreshed,\nI know you'll find your second wind!
Come play whenever you feel like it, all right?
Exploration
Opening the menu already, are we? Mama was planning to give you\nan explanation later... Are you sure you want to fiddle with it now?
So impatient! Sadly, all I can let you do right now is summon.
I can't even permit you to use any of the things you've obtained so far. \nAre you still sure you want to open the menu?
Goodness, you're not giving Mama much of a choice here.
That's right. No need to worry your pretty head about any of that right now.
Do you want to hear the explanation after all?
You have a long road ahead of you, so you'll need to increase your power.
Hmm, where should I start?\nFirst, you need to arrange your allies in a loadout...
Actually, it would be much easier to explain in a demonstration.
It's mostly the same as any other game.
Well done!
You can also enhance allies and weapons, but... Oh, never mind.\nJust take a peek whenever you feel like it. Let's keep moving!
Oh my! This is Mama's Room!
Dear me, it looks like we have trouble again.
Mama will have to deal with this on her own.
I sense dark foes on the other side of that door.
I suppose we should return to The Cage.
Let's save the subquests and dark foes for another time.
I keep stories that I'm still restoring on the other side of this door.
The dark foes have been sneaking in so much lately!\nWe need to chase them out so we can restore the stories.
Let's try a subquest, shall we?
I don't think I'm up for that right now.
The dark foes won't leave this storage room alone—\nand I keep stories I'm still restoring in there! We need to chase the rascals out.
But only do that when you feel up to it, all right?
Well, that's done and dusted.
Let's save the subquests for another time and deal with these dark foes, all right?
Any stories you restore through subquests will be saved in the Library.\nDon't worry—the dark foes can't reach them there.
I'll make it so you can view them,\nas well as any weapon memories you set right in The Cage.
Oh, also...
Now you can try your hand at subquests in the Quests section of the Mama Menu.\nThese will help you earn materials for enhancements!
I'll make it so you can view them,\nas well as any weapon memories you set right in The Cage.
Now let's get back to The Cage.\nWe can leave through that door.
What should we do today?
There's just so much to do!
I'm much busier than I look!
*humming*
I feel so stiff lately...
Where shall we begin?
Mama could really use a vacation.
It seems we've finally reached the edge of The Cage.
Oh my! Mama's Room seems to have changed a bit, too.
The tree is bearing fruit.
A new door has been unlocked! Wonderful!
The other side of this door contains Summons you can only use once\nyou reach the edge of The Cage. Make sure to do so once per day!
You'll also find a special sort of battle called "Daily Challenges"\nthat you can only participate in once you reach the edge of The Cage.
Your loadout will need to include certain characters, which can\nmake fights a bit rough. Consider it a test of your strength.
Things certainly are getting busy!
It seems we've reached the edge of The Cage.
I suppose we should just wait around here for a bit.
Oh? What's this?
The tree has borne fruit.
You should definitely pick up everything you find on the floor!\nThat's good advice for life in general, actually.
The time has come for us to proceed further into The Cage.
We must see how the children are doing.
We can leave through the glowing door in the center.
Phew!
With the children gone, poor Mama has a hole in her heart...
Heh heh. Just kidding!
One of Mama's strong points is how quickly she can switch gears—\nand there's so much to do until our next task begins!
One of Mama's strong points is how quickly she can switch gears.
Perhaps we should see how things are going in The Cage.
Oh my! I sense quite the story waiting for us on the other side of that door.
Now let's see what kind of friend is waiting for us.

0.text_: Attempt the daily challenge with this deck?

1.text_: Oh, goodness... The dark foes have grown quite strong, haven't they?
If you ever start feeling outmatched, enhancement is the first thing you should try.\nI've actually been stocking up on items for an occasion just like this.
Use this to power yourself up, and then give it another go!
